description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1apqs","text":"Protocol was obtained from Ulschan Bathe and Kristen Van Geller from UF on May 2023 and optimized by myself.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f21s2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0dv3","text":"This protocol is a variation on the highly efficient LiAc/SS/PEG method from Gietz et al., 2007 DOI: 10.1038/nprot.2007.13","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":101,"length":21}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"49515FE33D7611EF92D40A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1038/nprot.2007.13"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6lvst","text":"2 days before yeast transformation, start 3mL pre-culture of your yeast strain in appropriate selective media. Growth in SC is fine for this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crhg6","text":"If the DNA to be transformed is for integration, linearize your plasmid the night before and store in the fridge or freezer the morning of the transformation. If you do, heat inactivate the enzyme.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7efq4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1mmp","text":"Note: for integrations, a high amount of DNA is needed for efficient transformation. Make the following digestion:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87d9g","text":"55.5 uL plasmid (aim for a concentration of 90-300 ng/uL, more is better)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vmkt","text":"6.5 uL CutSmart/r3.1/NEB buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7r2bn","text":"3 uL Restriction enzyme (BE SURE TO DOUBLE CHECK WHICH ENZYME YOU ARE USING)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qao8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v0or","text":"Double check the expected cut patterns on a gel by running 1 uL of digest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3k1hd","text":"Dilute pre-culture, 1:35 into   YPD per 3 transformations (875uL of pre-culture into 30mL YPD). Grow until OD600 of 0.6 (it is acceptable between 0.6 and 1.5) is reach (approximately  )","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":96,"length":89}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":183,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5upll","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27kfv","text":"Note: For slow growing strains, start the cultures the night before. For example, JH45 takes 9-12 hours to reach OD 0.6 from a starter dilution of 0.13.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cak9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d27bk","text":"Note: in my experience, addition of antibiotic is necessary at this step especially for slow growing yeast strains as this helps prevent contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79qc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iq15","text":"Note: when transforming plasmids, the OD matters less and as long as it is somewhere between 0.4 and 1.5 you will get transformants, but when you are looking for integration, the ideal range is between 0.6 and 0.8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sfvu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6k7c","text":"Note: Yeast should have at least 2 divisions to maximize transformation efficiency, but not more than 4. Do not start a very dilute starter culture the night before unless you know that the yeast genotype is slow to grow and will reach desired OD overnight from 1:35~ dilution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":21600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9r98","text":"When yeast reaches OD600 of 0.6, pour into   falcon tube and spin at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":69,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b2br5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29f3b","text":"During this step, put your ssDNA in a   water bath/heat block for 5 minutes, and immediately plunge in ice. Mark on the vial how many times the ssDNA has been boiled. Discard after 3 boils.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39},{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":149}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d75n6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"620j2","text":"Note: pellet should be whitish, or off-white. A spot of brown at the center of the pellet is expected, but yellowish or brownish color overall is indicative of contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vrr7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"1500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"95","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dpoq","text":"resuspend in   TE/LiAc/water solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5fhlr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24irs","text":"Note: a   suspension will actually yield more than 300, so you may instead choose to resuspend in less volume (~  ) to yield a total volume of   , which serves to concentrate the cells more.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":112,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":143,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1natj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"233","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e0s4t","text":"Aliquot  per transformation to individual tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"91vkm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chb17","text":"Note: because of the volume of the cells, resuspension in 300 uL from previous step will yield more than actually 300 uL. 100 uL of this, even though not truly 1/3rd of resuspension is OK to use, or more can be used, but adjust the additives amount accordingly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ccjih","text":"Add, in the following order:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"csoi5","text":"  of   salmon sperm ssDNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2m720","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38a7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74pje","text":"Note: high quality ssDNA is critical - don't overuse your ssDNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3cbni","text":"DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3cv0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mog8","text":"For linear DNA: add 65 uL of overnight, heat-inactivated digest. You want upwards of 5 ug, and I have had success with 12 ug, but I do not know if there is an upper cap.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60v6u","text":"For plasmid DNA: around 1 ug of plasmid is sufficient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vq5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7a3a","text":"If you are cotransforming with linear dsDNA (e.g., as a repair fragment for Cas9) generated from PCR, there is no need to PCR cleanup the fragment. Add the entirety of the PCR reaction alongside the plasmid DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ca4m1","text":"Mix gently by flicking the tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cilb5","text":"  of \"PEG mix\" (see materials for recipe)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6l9ej","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vcm6","text":"The PEG mixture must be made the day of with freshly sterilized PEG (do not autoclave, filter sterilize it)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2o1i0","text":"Mix gently by pipetting until homogeneous","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cev38","text":"Incubate at   for   with rotation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e9d77","text":"This can be allowed up to 3 hrs if necessary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2700,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tb6p","text":"Incubate at   for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f36d8","text":"This must be stuck to as close as possible ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"42","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f2fbo","text":"Centrifuge at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":14,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dnsm9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"700","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ds4ss","text":"Resuspend in   sterile water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ab4hd","text":"Can also resuspend in less if low efficiency expected","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ela3b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et4ql","text":"Note : be certain of the sterility of your water!!! I suggest autoclaving fresh MilliQ water the morning of the transformation and stick it in the cold room ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87u69","text":"Plate unto appropriate selection plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3jqs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cs3rl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bp3f","text":"Ensure that your plating method will keep everything sterile: use L spreaders or sterile glass beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff8vo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h8ue","text":"Note: do not plate the entire volume of cells unto a plate. High plating density decreases growth and may also obscure selection if using minimal plates. Instead, I recommend pouring 3 plates for each transformation and plating 3:2:1 and saving some resuspension in the cold room just in case. This is especially important when selecting with auxotrophy, in which case 1/10-20th of the total resuspension buffer is typically enough to yield some transformants. You will not see any transformants if you plate all your cells in one plate, even if it worked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":292,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"49iup","text":"If selection is antibiotic, cells should be resuspended in 600ul of YPD and rotated at 30ºC for at least 5 hours but can be left overnight if necessary. Alternatively, transformations can be plated onto YPD plates and replica-plated the next day onto appropriate antibiotic containing plates.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b2sqt","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":43,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"3cl7l","text":"Auxotrophic selection is OK to plate as is.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9npce","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k3lo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1t30p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d6uub","text":"CEN/ARS plasmid colonies can be expected in 2-3 days, genomic integrations take between 3-5. p1 integrations can take 4-7 days to appear.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Yeast transformation
